channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: President Biden signaled to House Democrats this week that he is seriously considering taking action to forgive student-loan debt on a large scale https://t.co/uW8jFwxk1g
China’s President Xi Jinping has told officials to ensure the country’s economic growth outpaces the U.S.’s this year even as its economy sags under Covid-19 https://t.co/1SpcwJH9p4
General Motors is developing a hybrid Chevrolet Corvette that could arrive at dealerships as early as next year https://t.co/y4exaDmoMP
Biden has signaled to House Democrats that he is seriously considering erasing some student-loan debt as the midterm elections approach https://t.co/EIrOLk2MJU

Russian state oil giant Rosneft failed to sell a huge batch of oil, a sign that looming sanctions are playing havoc with the energy industry driving the country’s bruised economy https://t.co/9A4DdrMHkZ
Russia will halt gas flows to Poland and Bulgaria starting Wednesday over wartime payment terms imposed by Moscow https://t.co/yt0IjTazax
Elon Musk plans to reduce content rules Twitter has adopted to fight abuse and attract ad dollars, betting that users and advertisers will want to come along for the ride https://t.co/kOtkXY4D5y
Almost four months after the actress Betty White died, her estate has sold one of her longtime California homes for $10.775 million and listed the other for $10.575 million https://t.co/kBJ6bQtwAX
These people were part of the big job switch. Now they have big regrets. “The grass isn’t always greener on the other side.” https://t.co/vuyTbodNy2

From @WSJopinion: Russia invaded Ukraine for two reasons. One is Moscow’s obsessive pursuit of nationalist and imperial ambitions. The other is Putin’s misperception, writes @cblatts. https://t.co/xcI684qn4N
Harvard University has pledged $100 million to redress its ties to slavery. It comes after a new report found the school profited from slavery. https://t.co/zGy5UErwpA

Moldova placed its security forces on alert after blasts in a breakaway pro-Russian enclave stirred concern over the role some 1,500 Russian troops there could play in Moscow’s war in neighboring Ukraine https://t.co/gdY0CYh9Pu
Vice President Kamala Harris tested positive for Covid-19 on Tuesday, her spokeswoman said https://t.co/HzfVChGOdW
From @WSJopinion: Will Elon Musk’s vision for Twitter work? Who knows. But it will be fascinating to watch him try to break Silicon Valley’s culture of progressive conformity. https://t.co/uwOg6Kbcvi
Elon Musk broke nearly every rule in the deal-making playbook. How he landed Twitter anyway. https://t.co/qRx4FY0jM0
Germany will provide Ukraine with about 50 antiaircraft cannon tanks, in what will mark a rare major delivery of non-Soviet weapons systems by a Western country https://t.co/3sTgNBSrIs
Elon Musk, who has lamented having too little time, adds Twitter to a list of duties that includes running Tesla and SpaceX https://t.co/T7kMTTdWTO
Fidelity plans to let investors put a bitcoin account in their 401(k)s—the first major retirement-plan provider to do so https://t.co/seShLEj31s
Twitter could undergo some substantial reshaping after accepting Elon Musk’s $44 billion takeover bid to go private #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/wwCJBGwjZq https://t.co/pS2hvQAUzr
Saudi royals have sold more than $600 million worth of real estate, yachts and artwork since Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman tightened the ruling family’s purse strings https://t.co/ASlTOLdoFq

Republican lawmakers who have criticized Twitter over its content policies are applauding Elon Musk’s deal to take Twitter private, while many Democrats said the acquisition shows billionaires have too much power and need more scrutiny https://t.co/mSYvr570iQ
Fidelity is adding bitcoin as an option for 401(k) plans later this year, the first major retirement-plan provider to do so https://t.co/3k0F4rUMni
Donald Trump was held in contempt of court and fined $10,000 a day for failing to comply with a subpoena by New York's attorney general in a civil-fraud investigation https://t.co/ESdNlUFTyz
Twitter was expected to reject Elon Musk’s offer. But behind the scenes, its bankers called the bid fair and said the company could struggle to get there on its own. https://t.co/DWdVQB92qk

Elon Musk's Twitter bid puts a $5 billion-a-year advertising business into the hands of someone who has publicly questioned the platform's advertising business model and whose current company—Tesla—buys no advertising https://t.co/suHJ9HMEhJ
Nearly 25 years after she bought it, Janet Jackson is listing her apartment on New York’s Central Park for $8.995 million https://t.co/IaLxFZitel

Twitter and Elon Musk have a deal. WSJ’s @charlesforelle, @realrobcopeland and @georgia_wells discuss what this means for Twitter's business and the broader social-media landscape. https://t.co/9wfoA898zW
Twitter employees reacted Monday to the prospect of a takeover by Elon Musk with a mix of enthusiasm, fear and humor: “It’s a time of genuine discomfort & uncertainty." https://t.co/uvBzxfNxJM
The U.S. holds one sanctions card close to the vest: Vladimir Putin's alleged girlfriend and the mother of at least three of his children, the government says. https://t.co/VIiolfO37H
Elon Musk will need cash flow from Twitter’s ad business to pay off debt used to back his deal to buy the company, explains @djtgallagher #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/e9qlPkHhio https://t.co/DiZY00HkfU
Twitter accepted Elon Musk’s bid to take over the company, the biggest move yet for the world’s richest man. Here’s how he got to this point. https://t.co/d3BSksZYsx
“Well, it’s a bitch”: Stunned by subscriber loss, Netflix vows to rein in costs. https://t.co/VcthpJA9Zn
Breaking: Twitter accepted Elon Musk’s bid to take over the company, giving the world’s richest man control over the influential social-media network https://t.co/3zfPvsPOJL
Twitter is in advanced discussions to sell itself to Elon Musk and could complete a deal Monday, people familiar with the matter said. Here's what we know so far. https://t.co/k6zo6zuAdt
Real Madrid has fought its way through to the Champions League semifinals on the backs of the two oldest players on its roster: Karim Benzema, 34, and Luka Modric, 36 https://t.co/nvXU2g2xwp
Heard on the Street: Unless Elon Musk finds a way to pay for Twitter entirely out of his own pocket, he’ll have to be accountable to others as well https://t.co/3idbgom9mb
Donald Trump was held in contempt of court and fined $10,000 a day for failing to comply with a subpoena by New York's attorney general in a civil-fraud investigation https://t.co/2eAmbuTCX7
A Russian blackout of data on government debt and trade, among other categories, is making it harder for the West to know if sanctions are working https://t.co/OSZ2ZASIuW
Russia’s heavy use and loss of weapons in Ukraine, combined with severe Western sanctions, will crimp its military might and lucrative arms exports for years to come https://t.co/fveCbAN0Py

Twitter shares ticked up in premarket trading on Monday as the social-media company could be finalizing a deal to sell itself to Elon Musk as soon as Monday, people familiar with the matter say #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/rotRygZzhy https://t.co/dC2AbBC3mw
Around 200,000 children have enrolled in Poland’s public schools since Russia invaded Ukraine https://t.co/ITfRUBw6Yj

The U.S. has pledged over $1 billion in aid to Ukraine, in the form of economic and military support. The money will help both in fighting the war and rebuilding afterward. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/ay1uVaW6hJ https://t.co/JrHjqGhgNk
Twitter is in advanced talks to sell itself to Elon Musk and could announce a deal Monday, at a value of $54.20 a share, people familiar said https://t.co/P7gHNwNmVx
More than a month after the Big Four accounting firms pledged to cut ties with their Russian operations, none of them has left the country https://t.co/rQK02FhXaB
Nestlé has created bomb shelters in factories and rerouted supplies to keep providing food in Ukraine amid Russia’s assault https://t.co/FtU9B0ctWk
The U.S. wants Russia weakened so "it can’t do the kinds of things that it has done in invading Ukraine," Defense Secretary Austin said after Kyiv visit https://t.co/RVDH8VRp3P
The world’s oldest verified living person, Kane Tanaka of Japan, has died at age 119 https://t.co/Z1fCxG8nCI
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/P8yJhCZGAo
Bombed factories and burning fuel depots in Ukraine are poisoning the air, soil and water. Experts fear the war’s environmental damage could last decades. https://t.co/cLUyllqzOQ

Twitter is expected to reject Elon Musk’s $43 billion bid to buy the company as too low. If that really was his “best and final” offer, as he has said, a tender offer would be his next-best option. Here’s what that means. https://t.co/GZsmYNiSTz
